notesStmt.note: Defective at the end. Side margins are too closely cut and some of the marginal notes are not fully preserved. On folio 422v ink has nearly entirely faded.

An index of commentaries from c17th century is given on folio 419v.A note of purchase of the manuscript, 18th or 19th century, folio 1v. M. Conti: inscribed in a note of purchase, folio 3r, with a date of 8 January 1836. Yehudah ben Benyamin ha-Menaḳed ben Yo'av, probably also the scribe: inscribed in a contract of sale, folio 419v. Yehudah bar Benyamin sold the manuscript to Rabi Natan and Rabi Avraham, sons of Rabi Yeḥiel, son of Daniel of Monte Santo, for 15 gold florins.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A collection of commentaries and notes on the biblical books, except the Pentateuch, by various authors.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each. Quires signed with Hebrew letters at the beginning and at the end, also marked with catchwords at the end. Running titles in the upper margins, occasionally cut off.
